intro: Crepis polycephala, commonly known as the many-headed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with a basal rosette of leaves and several flowering stems. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and are followed by small, oval-shaped achenes. Crepis polycephala is known for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in disturbed habitats.
